title: 2450 Francisco Street
Reason(s) for removal: Property owner applied for removal permit (785452); dead; can be replaced if shifted away from water line

title: 409 Vallejo Street
Reason(s) for removal: Dead; replanting currently not planned due to very difficult planting area and difficult access to water, hillside already has a lot of vegetation

title: 413 Vallejo Street
Reason(s) for removal: Dead due to being topped; replanting currently not planned due to very difficult planting area and difficult access to water, hillside already has a lot of vegetation

title: 1466 35th Avenue
Reason(s) for removal: PG&E topped and removed critical meristem to stop all future growth under CPUC General Order 95 Rule 35, as a result tree is in very poor condition and will become 100% dead in immediate future, additionally 90% of canopy was removed after PG&E pruning and after lower fronds were (properly) pruned to create sidewalk clearance; replaceable with species appropriate under high voltage power lines

title: 2 Pizarro Way
Reason(s) for removal: Has arbutus fungal canker with 100% mortality rate, there is no cure or treatment and canker will spread and girdle cambium then kill tree as it forms cracks, prompt removal critical for preventing spread to other arbutus; replaceable with species appropriate for narrow sidewalk

title: 183 Westwood Drive
Reason(s) for removal: Has arbutus fungal canker with 100% mortality rate, there is no cure or treatment and canker will spread and girdle cambium then kill tree as it forms cracks, prompt removal critical for preventing spread to other arbutus; replaceable with species appropriate for narrow sidewalk

title: 183 Westwood Drive
Reason(s) for removal: Has arbutus fungal canker with 100% mortality rate, there is no cure or treatment and canker will spread and girdle cambium then kill tree as it forms cracks, prompt removal critical for preventing spread to other arbutus; replaceable with species appropriate for narrow sidewalk

title: 4210 Ocean Avenue
Reason(s) for removal: Property owner applied for removal permit (785453); ramp design to become compliant with ADA violation notice is within footprint of trees on Ocean Avenue entrance. Project redesigned in attempt to save trees but could not meet compliance without placing in footprint, trees on Everglade Drive frontage were saved; three new trees will be planted on Everglade frontage where existing gaps in plantings exist.

title: 2555 Diamond Street
Reason(s) for removal: SF planning commission already approved building design and forced the hand of the Bureau of Urban Forestry to approve this tree for removal; owner has agreed to plant a new 25+ft tall red maple and has submitted a utility plan which allows replacement

title: 2943 Harrison Street
Reason(s) for removal: Property owner applied for removal permit, significant trunk rot and declining canopy; property owner will replace

title: 2943 Harrison Street (front yard tree)
Reason(s) for removal: Property owners are concerned the palm will crack a window during wind storm, palm tree in poor condition; propety owner will replace
